answers.author: Michael Smith
answers.text:
The City of Oklahoma City has 621.2 Square Miles of area;
We currently have 13 pothole crews, 10 of those crews are Hot Mix patch trucks, and 3 are Spray Patch trucks. 
Materials used - Hot mix asphalt Type “C” with tack; Pro-line Cold lay asphalt; 3/8 chips and Crs-2
We never stop patching; we patch year round; we use hot mix asphalt when weather is decent (35 degrees and rising).  When inclement weather strikes we use the Cold Lay asphalt, and yes we still patch during snow & ice operations, primarily on snow routes.  Our spray patchers are used primarily in the rural settings. 
Types of patches - throw and go, square up and patch, and skin patches and/or any combination to provide a safe patch.
If you would like further information, please contact:
Mike DeGiacomo, Street Superintendent
The City of Oklahoma City
mike.degiacomo@okc.gov
405.682.7029

author: Hannah Wolford
text: A CPM jurisdiction is interested in learning how other street maintenance departments handle pothole patching.  Specifically, they would like to know when it is performed and what material/equipment is used.  Any information provided regarding jurisdiction practices would be helpful.
title: Pothole Patching: Material & Equipment Used
